channel.title: Cache and RuneScape model format
channel.description:
Hi, I'm new in this community though I've been registered for some time. I've been around since the Kaitniek forums days, and back then I made some free scripts for the community.
Back on the topic, I've been coding a model viewer in D + OpenGL (close relative to C++) based on the Bentski codebase, since I couldn't compile his source in Linux. I'll release it in a few days under the GPL license.
Now I want to understand the cache system of RuneScape, I've found a few Java packages here to unpack things but didn't have much luck running them.
Can anyone provide me a few details or specifications about the cache system?
Thanks! :)

item.title: Cache and RuneScape model format
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

the BEST way to learn would be to look at the clients code,

take a look at “RS2 Deobfuscator”, and browse around in the code to find where it loads the files

Read full topic

item.title: Cache and RuneScape model format
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

Slivion recently released a cache unpacker and packer, but truthfully it’s not very useful. It only unpacks and packs data files and only works on 460+ caches.

Defyboy released an unpacker long ago of which I’ve found to be useful, but again, doesn’t work on -377 caches.

Miss Silabsoft has released something called a Model Grabber, which grabs data files from the RuneScape Cache.

Currently there are no 100% useful packers, editors, or converters available to the public, but some people have written their own.

Truthfully the only thing that might be used is a Hex Editor, as a command line… line? was found to save the edits.

I guess thats what you wanted to know?

Read full topic
